page.title: 06PEGSDON COMMON FARM
page.content: The farmer owns the farm of 420 acres and jointly manages 220acres of farm land at High Down.The farm is arable and beef cattle.The crops grown are wheat,barley,field beans and oilseed rape.The grain from the farm is sold mainly to grain merchants,and the cattle go to St.Ives for slaughter. The field beans are used for animal food,and for making dark flour,used in some breads on the continent,and the rape seed is used for making oil.Rape oil is more widely available in the shops now.Wheat is for cereals and flour and the barley for malt used in distilling,and for beer and vinegar. For all farmers,any grain of correct quality not sold for other use ,can be sold to the Intervention Board,by whom it is stored for later use.Many thousands of tonnes are stored in the old brewery in Luton.
